metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7486 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
PostgreSQL versions 8.4 - 9.6 are vulnerable to information leak inpg_user_mappings view which discloses foreign server passwords to any userhaving USAGE privilege on the associated foreign server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
libecpg6 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpq5 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.17-0ubuntu0.14.04').
